00042     /*
00043      * try to detect some things 
00044      */
00045 /*
00046 #ifdef WIN32
00047 #define SC_INTEL
00048 #define SC_WIN32
00049 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00050 #define SC_MSVC
00051 #endif
00052 #endif
00053 
00054 #if defined SC_INTEL            //intel
00055 
00056 #define _LITTLE_ENDIAN
00057 
00058 #if defined SC_WIN32            //win32
00059 
00060 #if defined SC_MSVC             //msvc
00061 #ifndef _MSC_VER
00062 #error Makefile error:MSVC compiler not detected
00063 #endif
00064 #include <string.h>
00065 #define MAXINT 0x7fffffff
00066 #ifdef _DEBUG
00067 #define  DEBUG
00068 #endif
00069     typedef __int64 int64;
00070 #define INT64SUPPORTED
00071 #else
00072 #error Makefile error:unknown compiler under Win32
00073 #endif
00074 
00075 #elif defined SC_DOS || defined SC_BEOS || defined SC_LINUX || defined SC_FREEBSD || defined SC_UNIXWARE || defined SC_SCOUNIX
00076 #if defined SC_GCC              //gcc
00077 #include <strings.h>
00078 #include <values.h>
00079     typedef long long int64;
00080 #define INT64SUPPORTED
00081 
00082 #else
00083 #error Makefile error:unknown compiler under DOS/BEOS/LINUX/FreeBSD/Linux/SCOUnix
00084 #endif
00085 
00086 #else
00087 #error Makefile error:unknown OS
00088 #endif                          //system
00089 
00090 #elif defined SC_ANY            //any proc/any OS
00091 #if defined SC_GCC              //gcc
00092 #include <strings.h>
00093 #include <values.h>
00094     typedef long long int64;
00095 #define INT64SUPPORTED
00096 #else                           //any compiler
00097 #include <strings.h>
00098 #include <values.h>
00099 #endif
00100 
00101 #else                           //non-intel
00102 #error Non-intel processor set up (seems like makefile error)
00103 #endif
00104 
00105         */
00106 
00107 #include <string.h>
00108 #define MAXINT 0x7fffffff
00109 typedef long long int64;

00119 #define DEBUG
00120 
00121 //When DEBUG is on, the DEBUGLEVEL says:
00122 //0 - log all
00123 //1 - some are skipped - declare.c
00124 //2 ? more skipped
00125 //3 ? "clean" - assembler and some comments
00126 //4 - "clean" - only assembler + lines
00127 //5 - "clean" - only assembler
00128 #define DEBUGLEVEL 0
00129

00131 #define malloc my_malloc
00132 #define free my_free
00133 #define realloc my_realloc

00137     extern void *my_myrealloc ( void *p, int s );

00140 #ifdef DEBUG
00141 #define debflush()  fflush(debfile)
00142     extern int debug_flag;
00143     extern FILE *debfile;
00144 #ifdef EXACT_DEBUG
00145 #define adeb0(x) {if (debug_flag){printf(x);}}
00146 #define adeb1(x,y) {if (debug_flag){printf(x,y);}}
00147 #define adeb2(x,y,z) {if (debug_flag){printf(x,y,z);}}
00148 #define adeb3(x,y,z,q) {if (debug_flag){printf(x,y,z,q);}}
00149 #else                           
00150 #define adeb0(x) {if (debug_flag){fprintf(debfile,x);}}
00151 #define adeb1(x,y) {if (debug_flag){fprintf(debfile,x,y);}}
00152 #define adeb2(x,y,z) {if (debug_flag){fprintf(debfile,x,y,z);}}
00153 #define adeb3(x,y,z,q) {if (debug_flag){fprintf(debfile,x,y,z,q);}}
00154 #endif
00155 #if DEBUGLEVEL>=3
00156 //clean
00157 #define deb0(x)
00158 #define deb1(x,y)
00159 #define deb2(x,y,z)
00160 #define deb3(x,y,z,q)
00161 #else
00162 //normal
00163 #define deb0 adeb0
00164 #define deb1 adeb1
00165 #define deb2 adeb2
00166 #define deb3 adeb3
00167 #endif
00168 //with gcc this one would work:
00169 //#define deb(x...) {if (debug_flag)fprintf(debfile,x);}
00170 
00171 #else                           
00172 
00173 #define debflush()
00174 #define adeb0(x)
00175 #define adeb1(x,y)
00176 #define adeb2(x,y,z)
00177 #define adeb3(x,y,z,q)
00178 
00179 #define deb0 adeb0
00180 #define deb1 adeb1
00181 #define deb2 adeb2
00182 #define deb3 adeb3
00183 //#define deb(x...)
00184 //#define debprintf(x...)
00185 #define debif(x)
00186 #endif

00221 /* scScript - seer script header (as (int []))*/
00222 #define hdrAllSize              3
00223 #define hdrHeaderSize           4
00224 #define hdrSymbolOffset         5
00225 #define hdrCodeOffset           6
00226 #define hdrDataOffset           7
00227 #define hdrConstsOffset         8
00228 #define hdrInitOffset           9
00229 #define hdrCodeSize             10
00230 #define hdrDataSize             11
00231 #define hdrConstsSize           12
00232 #define hdrStackSize            13
00233 #define hdrImportedOffset       14
00234 #define hdrConstructOffset      15
00235 #define hdrDestructOffset       16

00237 #define hdrHeaderSizeOf         18*4

00240     struct scSymbol;
00241     struct _value;
00242 //PREDEFINED TYPES,returned by scvalGetValType
00243     typedef enum valTYPE
00244     {
00245         valINT,
00246         valLONG,
00247         valCHAR,
00248         valFIXED,
00249         valFLOAT,
00250         valDOUBLE,
00251         valSHORT,
00252         valREGISTER,
00253         valVOID,
00254         //not predefined types:
00255         valPOINTER,
00256         valSTRUCT,
00257         valSCRIPT,
00258     } valTYPE;
00259 //TYPE descriptor
00260     enum
00261     {
00262         typTYPE = 1 + 2 + 4 + 8,    //switch(flags&typTYPE) {case typPREDEFINED:}
00263         typPREDEFINED = 0,      //in main :index of basic types
00264         typUSERDEFINED = 1,     //in main:pointer to symbol with type
00265         typSTRUCT = 2, typUNION = 3, typENUM = 4,   //in main there is a list
00266         typSCRIPT = 8,          //alike struct (in main)
00267         typINVALID = 15,
00268 
00269         typOPTION = 16 + 32 + 64 + 128, //option standing before
00270         typCONST = 16,
00271         typUNSIGNED = 32,
00272         typSTATIC = 64,
00273         typREGISTER = 128,
00274         typCONSTRUCTOR = 256,
00275         typDESTRUCTOR = 512,
00276 /*We don't need these, do we?
00277       typSIZE=512+1024+2048,
00278       typDEFAULT=0,
00279       typSHORT=512,typLONG=1024,
00280 */
00281     };
00282 
00283     typedef struct scType
00284     {
00285         int flags;              //typPREDEFINED...
00286         char *params;           //it is e.g.  (1aff32a) or **[12]* (p->p->table[12]of p->T
00287         //what about function
00288         struct scSymbol *main;  //Main type or Table with scSymbol, last has flags==-1(structs)
00289     } scType;
00290 
00291     typedef enum scAddrFlag
00292     {
00293         adrPOINTER = 1 + 2 + 4,
00294         adrSTOREPOINTER = 1 + 2,
00295         adrES = 1,
00296         adrDS = 2,
00297         adrBP = 3,
00298         adrCPU = 4,
00299         adrSTORECPU = adrCPU & adrSTOREPOINTER,
00300         adrCS = 5,
00301         adrIMMIDIATE = 8,
00302         adrREGISTER = 16,
00303         adrIMPORTED = 32,
00304         adrTYPEONLY = 64,
00305         adrSCRIPT = 128,
00306         adrADDRESS = 256,       //we have eg [ES+12], but we should have address of it
00307         //,like a0=ES+12; with this we use PUSHADR etc.
00308         //with * or [] we need only to delete this flag.
00309         //for address we have to scvalPutToRegister.
00310     } scAddrFlag;
00311 /*
00312  a0    adrREGISTER
00313  12    adrIMMIDIATE
00314  [CS+a0]adrREGISTER|adrCS
00315 */
00316 
00317     typedef struct scAddress
00318     {
00319         int address;            //here we store offset, register, but not value!
00320         scAddrFlag flags;
00321         union
00322         {
00323             int ival;
00324             float fval;
00325             double dval;
00326         } val;                  //typically value,
00327         //but when imported, ival stores dispatcher number
00328     } scAddress;
00329 
00330     typedef struct scSymbol
00331     {
00332         scAddress adr;          //copy it to val
00333         char *name;
00334         char *import_name;      //usually NULL
00335 //        int used;
00336         int params;             //size of params
00337         struct _value *val;
00338         scType type;
00339         struct scSymbol *next;  //TODO:here should be a place for parent
00340         struct scSymbol *parent;
00341         void *reserved;
00342     } scSymbol;
00343 
00344     typedef struct
00345     {
00346         scAddress adr;          //IMPORTED flag must be correct
00347         scType type;
00348         scSymbol *sym;
00349     } _value;
00350 /*  Examples of description
00351                 Adres:Adres,flags,val        Type:flags,params,main
00352 int x;  _value={{12,adrDS|adrIMMIDIATE,0}, {typPREDEFINED,NULL,valINT},x}
00353 a5      _value={{5,adrREGISTER,0}          {typPREDEFINED,NULL,valINT},x}
00354 [DS+a4] _value={{4,adrDS|adrREGISTER,0},   {typSTRUCT,NULL,xxxx},xxx}
00355 [12]    _value={{12,adrIMPORT,0},          {typPREDEFINED,NULL,valINT},x}
00356 int *x; _value={{12,adrDS|adrIMMIDIATE,0}, {typPREDEFINED,"*",valINT},x}
00357 */

00452     typedef struct Source_Text
00453     {
00454         char **lines;
00455         int act_line, act_char;
00456         int num_lines, alloced_lines;
00457         int erase;              //permission for deletion after use
00458         char name[MAXLENGTH];
00459         int linedif;
00460         unsigned char lexema[MAXLENGTH];
00461                 int lexema_len;
00462         int lextype;            //==0 - unknown
00463         int lexstart;
00464         int whitespaces;        //before readed lexema.
00465         int newline;            //if newline apeared
00466         scPosition lastpos;
00467     } Source_Text;

00500 MACROS:
00501 check_error
00502 ***********************************************************************/
00503 /*
00504 #define serr(num,x) {scScript_Error(ST,__FILE__,__LINE__,num,x);goto scError_Exit;}
00505 #define serr2(num,x,y) {scScript_Error(ST,__FILE__,__LINE__,num,x,y);goto scError_Exit;}
00506 #define serr3(num,x,y,z) {scScript_Error(ST,__FILE__,__LINE__,num,x,y,z);goto scError_Exit;}
00507 #define serr4(num,x,y,z,q) {scScript_Error(ST,__FILE__,__LINE__,num,x,y,z,q);goto scError_Exit;}
00508 #define cerr {if (scErrorNo) goto scError_Exit;}
00509 #define rerr(x) {scRuntime_Error(x);goto scError_Exit;}
00510 #define rerr2(x,y) {scRuntime_Error(x,y);goto scError_Exit;}
00511 */
00512 #define serr(num,x) {scScript_Error(ST,__FILE__,__LINE__,num,x);longjmp(act.jump,1);}
00513 #define serr2(num,x,y) {scScript_Error(ST,__FILE__,__LINE__,num,x,y);longjmp(act.jump,1);}
00514 #define serr3(num,x,y,z) {scScript_Error(ST,__FILE__,__LINE__,num,x,y,z);longjmp(act.jump,1);}
00515 #define serr4(num,x,y,z,q) {scScript_Error(ST,__FILE__,__LINE__,num,x,y,z,q);longjmp(act.jump,1);}
00516 //#define cerr {}
00517 #define rerr(x) {scRuntime_Error(x);goto scError_Exit;}
00518 #define rerr2(x,y) {scRuntime_Error(x,y);goto scError_Exit;}
00519 #define rerr3(x,y,z) {scRuntime_Error(x,y,z);goto scError_Exit;}

00568     typedef struct
00569     {
00570         _value *used;           //if used=NULL, it can be temporary!
00571         int locked;
00572     } RegsTable[256];

00574 #define duringIDLE                      0
00575 #define duringPREPROCESSING             1
00576 #define duringCOMPILING                 2
00577 
00578 #define optEXPR                         1
00579 #define optGLOBALEXPR                   2
00580 
00581     typedef struct
00582     {
00583         int during;
00584         RegsTable registers;
00585         int afterbp, dataused;  //first free byte in data segment (used by global vars)
00586         int stacksize;
00587         int ip;                 //exact copy of code.pos
00588         int unreal;             //the code generated may not apear on output!
00589         int lines_compiled;
00590         jmp_buf jump;
00591         int options;
00592         int lastInitIp, lastFuncIp;
00593         pmem code, inits, consts, final, imports;
00594     } ActData__;
